snippet: In the snowy wastes of Siachen, where Pakistani and Indian soldiers face off in a battle zone ringed by Himalayan peaks, the fight is against the mountain, not the man.
abstract: Avalanche that buried 124 Pakistani soldiers and 14 civilians draws an anguished reaction across the nation and puts a spotlight on a remote corner of the 65-year-old conflict of Kashmir, the disputed mountain territory that lies at the emotional heart of the conflict with India; incident focuses attention on whether the battle is worth the price.
lead_paragraph: In the snowy wastes of Siachen, where Pakistani and Indian soldiers face off in a battle zone ringed by Himalayan peaks, the fight is against the mountain, not the man.

headline.seo: Siachen Avalanche Puts Spotlight on India-Pakistan Conflict
headline.main: Disaster Reignites Debate Over Battle at Earth’s Ceiling
headline.print_headline: Disaster Reignites Debate Over Battle at Earth’s Ceiling
